@psychosistherapyproject is a low-cost specialist service for people experiencing psychosis. Extremely rare service in the U.K., as people living with psychosis usually don't get talking therapy treatment through the national health service (mostly only medication). Plus, it is open-ended or long-term therapy and therapists are extremely experienced or are undergoing specialist training. It's currently available at Islington Mind (referrals from all London boroughs) and Lambeth & Southwark Mind (only residents from the borough). I am a volunteer at the service in Islington where I used to run an art group (which has now been taken over by one of our service users, a talented self-taught artist) and, after qualifying as a counsellor/psychotherapist, also started providing therapy there. We have a lovely and supporting community that goes beyond the therapy room, especially our drop-in service, where we share food and company, is highly popular. The founder and clinical lead is an expert in the field of psychosis and is also speaking out to reduce the stigma of mental health, especially the stigma and popular myths surrounding psychosis that are prevailing in society but also within mental health institutions.
